body: Heretics, they replace God with the church and papal elites, much like how protestants replace God with the Bible and "traditional values".

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

post.body: Are they the only true church or blasphemous heretics?
post.body_html: Are they the only true church or blasphemous heretics?
post.title: What are your views on Catholicism?

body:
I never really got it. I don't know what I feel about Religion in general these days but Catholicism seems to conflict with everything I've read in the Bible.

I mean, the core principle of the New Testament is that our human nature makes it impossible for us to truly live righteous lives in the eyes of God. So Christ becomes the perfect sacrifice and if we place our faith and trust in him, then his sacrifice atones for our sins. Nothing we can do, outside of trusting Christ can atone for our sins. At least according to the Bible.

Other concepts... "Call no man father for you have one father in Heaven," do not consult the dead (praying to Saints) and even the concept of The Pope. I'm not sure you can take on verse ("You are Peter and on this rock I will build my Church") and claim that you're a descendent of Peter's papacy and therefore you have the authority to forgive sins and alter Biblical law. 

Perhaps the most incriminating scripture is, "You will know them by their fruits." A Church that will fire a priest for questioning the Democrats but relocate them for fucking children doesn't exactly seem to be producing good fruit. 

If there are Catholics here, I don't dig my heels in the ground. I'm certainly open to consider new ideas. I just really don't get how a religion can violate its own source material for so long without being questioned by its members.
body_html:
I never really got it. I don't know what I feel about Religion in general these days but Catholicism seems to conflict with everything I've read in the Bible.

I mean, the core principle of the New Testament is that our human nature makes it impossible for us to truly live righteous lives in the eyes of God. So Christ becomes the perfect sacrifice and if we place our faith and trust in him, then his sacrifice atones for our sins. Nothing we can do, outside of trusting Christ can atone for our sins. At least according to the Bible.

Other concepts... "Call no man father for you have one father in Heaven," do not consult the dead (praying to Saints) and even the concept of The Pope. I'm not sure you can take on verse ("You are Peter and on this rock I will build my Church") and claim that you're a descendent of Peter's papacy and therefore you have the authority to forgive sins and alter Biblical law.

Perhaps the most incriminating scripture is, "You will know them by their fruits." A Church that will fire a priest for questioning the Democrats but relocate them for fucking children doesn't exactly seem to be producing good fruit.

If there are Catholics here, I don't dig my heels in the ground. I'm certainly open to consider new ideas. I just really don't get how a religion can violate its own source material for so long without being questioned by its members.

body:
> Catholicism seems to conflict with everything I've read in the Bible.

You said it. I know of many former Catholics who, after reading their Bible, left. They're actually encouraged NOT to read it.

post.body: Are they the only true church or blasphemous heretics?
post.body_html: Are they the only true church or blasphemous heretics?
post.title: What are your views on Catholicism?

body:
Catholics are arch-heretics and have spawned countless other heresies. They have abused the image of the church and have thereby created disgust and turmoil.

The Orthodox Church is the One True Church from the very beginning. There are no others. Period.

All of you who imagine you can cough up new ideas on a daily basis and call it a church are mistaken. It did not take Christ 2000 years to wait for the "real" truth to finally come out. There is only one immutable truth and it's been here from the beginning.
body_html:
Catholics are arch-heretics and have spawned countless other heresies. They have abused the image of the church and have thereby created disgust and turmoil.

The Orthodox Church is the One True Church from the very beginning. There are no others. Period.

All of you who imagine you can cough up new ideas on a daily basis and call it a church are mistaken. It did not take Christ 2000 years to wait for the "real" truth to finally come out. There is only one immutable truth and it's been here from the beginning.

post.title: What are your views on Catholicism?

body:
It's the one true church

Catholicism over orthodoxy seems to make more sense because every institution seems to have a central leader, so the papacy is that quality

then protestants seem to have more clearly broken away from Catholicism

(then Vatican 2 appears to contradict Catholicism so sedevacantism seems true)

Would be nice if more progress could be made at overcoming disagreements

post.body: Are they the only true church or blasphemous heretics?
post.body_html: Are they the only true church or blasphemous heretics?
post.title: What are your views on Catholicism?

body:
> Nothing we can do, outside of trusting Christ can atone for our sins.

I think Catholicism agrees with this, but also to "with fear and trembling work out your salvation" Phillipians 2:12 - so, while God gives graces to do things, people still have do avoid sin and do good in order to be saved

> "Call no man father for you have one father in Heaven,"

Haydock's Catholic commentary on this responds with:

> Call none your father ... Neither be ye called masters, &c. The meaning is, that our Father in heaven is incomparably more to be regarded, than any father upon earth: and no master is to be followed, who would lead us away from Christ. But this does not hinder but that we are by the law of God to have a due respect both for our parents and spiritual fathers, (1 Corinthians iv. 15,) and for our masters and teachers. (Challoner) --- This name was a title of dignity: the presidents of the assembly of twenty-three judges where so called; the second judge of the sanhedrim, &c. (Bible de Vence) --- Nothing is here forbidden but the contentious divisions, and self-assumed authority, of such as make themselves leaders and favourers of schisms and sects; as Donatus, Arius, Luther, Calvin, and innumerable other of very modern date. But by no means the title of father, attributed by the faith, piety, and confidence of good people, to their directors; for, St. Paul tells the Corinthians, that he is their only spiritual Father: If you have 10,000 instructors in Christ, yet not many Fathers. (1 Corinthians iv. 15.)

(I actually didn't know the answer to that objection until I looked this up right now)

on venerating the saints: 

https://www.newadvent.org/cathen/05188b.htm

> Dulia (Greek doulia; Latin servitus), a theological term signifying the honour paid to the saints, while latria means worship given to God alone, and hyperdulia the veneration offered to the Blessed Virgin Mary. St. Augustine (City of God X.2) distinguishes two kinds of servitus: "one which is due to men . . . which in Greek is called dulia; the other, latria, which is the service pertaining to the worship of God".

["Pope" Catholic encyclopedia entry](https://www.newadvent.org/cathen/12260a.htm) (might have info, I dunno what to say in particular about that - I think the orthodox accept the papacy but disagree about its powers, so the article seems to claim total rejection of the papacy originated in the 16th century with protestants)

> A Church that will fire a priest for questioning the Democrats but relocate them for [abusing] children doesn't exactly seem to be producing good fruit.

well personally this leads me to believe the Vatican 2 church is not the Catholic Church and that the false leaders in charge have used these tragic abuses to try to discredit Catholicism in the public's eyes (as well as selectively promoting bad things while suppressing good things). The abuses themselves I think I've seen have been somewhat on par with "normal" numbers of abuse by people in the population, it's just the media made it seem extra bad and Catholic clergy were held to a higher standard that was violated.

(You can look up articles that "priests abuse no more than average males of the population" articles / studies)

> I just really don't get how a religion can violate its own source material for so long without being questioned by its members.

I don't get that either but I think there will be a move against it eventually - although from what I've seen, the same kind of trends towards "modernism" have been respectively affecting protestants and orthodox in different ways

Nothing we can do, outside of trusting Christ can atone for our sins.

I think Catholicism agrees with this, but also to "with fear and trembling work out your salvation" Phillipians 2:12 - so, while God gives graces to do things, people still have do avoid sin and do good in order to be saved

"Call no man father for you have one father in Heaven,"

Haydock's Catholic commentary on this responds with:

Call none your father ... Neither be ye called masters, &c. The meaning is, that our Father in heaven is incomparably more to be regarded, than any father upon earth: and no master is to be followed, who would lead us away from Christ. But this does not hinder but that we are by the law of God to have a due respect both for our parents and spiritual fathers, (1 Corinthians iv. 15,) and for our masters and teachers. (Challoner) --- This name was a title of dignity: the presidents of the assembly of twenty-three judges where so called; the second judge of the sanhedrim, &c. (Bible de Vence) --- Nothing is here forbidden but the contentious divisions, and self-assumed authority, of such as make themselves leaders and favourers of schisms and sects; as Donatus, Arius, Luther, Calvin, and innumerable other of very modern date. But by no means the title of father, attributed by the faith, piety, and confidence of good people, to their directors; for, St. Paul tells the Corinthians, that he is their only spiritual Father: If you have 10,000 instructors in Christ, yet not many Fathers. (1 Corinthians iv. 15.)

(I actually didn't know the answer to that objection until I looked this up right now)

on venerating the saints:

https://www.newadvent.org/cathen/05188b.htm

Dulia (Greek doulia; Latin servitus), a theological term signifying the honour paid to the saints, while latria means worship given to God alone, and hyperdulia the veneration offered to the Blessed Virgin Mary. St. Augustine (City of God X.2) distinguishes two kinds of servitus: "one which is due to men . . . which in Greek is called dulia; the other, latria, which is the service pertaining to the worship of God".

"Pope" Catholic encyclopedia entry (might have info, I dunno what to say in particular about that - I think the orthodox accept the papacy but disagree about its powers, so the article seems to claim total rejection of the papacy originated in the 16th century with protestants)

A Church that will fire a priest for questioning the Democrats but relocate them for [abusing] children doesn't exactly seem to be producing good fruit.

well personally this leads me to believe the Vatican 2 church is not the Catholic Church and that the false leaders in charge have used these tragic abuses to try to discredit Catholicism in the public's eyes (as well as selectively promoting bad things while suppressing good things). The abuses themselves I think I've seen have been somewhat on par with "normal" numbers of abuse by people in the population, it's just the media made it seem extra bad and Catholic clergy were held to a higher standard that was violated.

(You can look up articles that "priests abuse no more than average males of the population" articles / studies)

I just really don't get how a religion can violate its own source material for so long without being questioned by its members.

I don't get that either but I think there will be a move against it eventually - although from what I've seen, the same kind of trends towards "modernism" have been respectively affecting protestants and orthodox in different ways

I'm not sure you can take on verse ("You are Peter and on this rock I will build my Church") and claim that you're a descendent of Peter's papacy and therefore you have the authority to forgive sins and alter Biblical law. 

Perhaps the most incriminating scripture is, "You will know them by their fruits." A Church that will fire a priest for questioning the Democrats but relocate them for fucking children doesn't exactly seem to be producing good fruit. 

If there are Catholics here, I don't dig my heels in the ground. I'm certainly open to consider new ideas. I just really don't get how a religion can violate its own source material for so long without being questioned by its members.
parent.body_html:
I never really got it. I don't know what I feel about Religion in general these days but Catholicism seems to conflict with everything I've read in the Bible.

I mean, the core principle of the New Testament is that our human nature makes it impossible for us to truly live righteous lives in the eyes of God. So Christ becomes the perfect sacrifice and if we place our faith and trust in him, then his sacrifice atones for our sins. Nothing we can do, outside of trusting Christ can atone for our sins. At least according to the Bible.

Other concepts... "Call no man father for you have one father in Heaven," do not consult the dead (praying to Saints) and even the concept of The Pope. I'm not sure you can take on verse ("You are Peter and on this rock I will build my Church") and claim that you're a descendent of Peter's papacy and therefore you have the authority to forgive sins and alter Biblical law.

Perhaps the most incriminating scripture is, "You will know them by their fruits." A Church that will fire a priest for questioning the Democrats but relocate them for fucking children doesn't exactly seem to be producing good fruit.

If there are Catholics here, I don't dig my heels in the ground. I'm certainly open to consider new ideas. I just really don't get how a religion can violate its own source material for so long without being questioned by its members.

post.body: Are they the only true church or blasphemous heretics?
post.body_html: Are they the only true church or blasphemous heretics?
post.title: What are your views on Catholicism?

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

author.bio:
Professional Chrischan. Striving for post-Enlightenment reconciliation. I love Jesus and hate the antichrist. ✝️ #NotAll

Gab: https://gab.com/stevejail
author.bio_html:
Professional Chrischan. Striving for post-Enlightenment reconciliation. I love Jesus and hate the antichrist. ✝️ #NotAll

Gab: https://gab.com/stevejail

body:
The Roman Catholic Church is rich in culture and makes great arguments for its authority, which are unfortunately undermined by the fact that they're quite often wrong, and have quite often been wrong for the past two thousand years.

I thank God for the Roman Catholic Church, because without them, we wouldn't have access to ancient philosophy and church literature as well as we do today. But do I take them as authoritative? No, not really. Otherwise I'd be a Roman Catholic rather than a Methodist.
body_html:
The Roman Catholic Church is rich in culture and makes great arguments for its authority, which are unfortunately undermined by the fact that they're quite often wrong, and have quite often been wrong for the past two thousand years.

I thank God for the Roman Catholic Church, because without them, we wouldn't have access to ancient philosophy and church literature as well as we do today. But do I take them as authoritative? No, not really. Otherwise I'd be a Roman Catholic rather than a Methodist.
